subject: Re: [junit] One test class per class (was Testing multiple interfaces?)
msgSnippet: ... Because of the activation energy required to split off a new class, move the right methods into it, remember to link it into the next level up, add it to
messageBody:
On Friday 03 June 2005 18:07, J. B. Rainsberger wrote:

> Yes. Even worse: two possibly overlapping, but often disjoint, sets of
> test fixture objects in the same test case class. Some tests use fixture
> A and others use fixture B. Why not put those in separate test case
> classes for clarity?

Because of the activation energy required to split off a new class, move
the right methods into it, remember to link it into the next level up,
add it to change control, fix the pesky layout infelicities the IDE likes
to avoid providing a configure-out option for, refactor the class comments,
etc?

[Pairing is good. Would that I could.]

--
Chris "electric hedgehog" Dollin
It's called *extreme* programming, not *stupid* programming.
